title.rendered: Minecraft: Play now for free in the browser – for the free version

content.rendered:
MINECRAFT May 08, 2019 @ 12:33pm

Minecraft is now playable in the browser for free. Mojang releases the Classic version with all the bugs from back then for the tenth anniversary. You can start and play directly in your browser without downloading anything. We’ll take you straight to the free version.


You can now play Minecraft directly in the browser. (Source: Screenshot Mojang)

Show it to the blocks because Minecraft Classic is free to play in celebration of Minecraft’s tenth anniversary, Mojang announced on Twitter. It takes you to the original creative mode with 32 blocks and all the bugs from back then.

You don’t need a download at all and can get started right in your browser. According to the games magazine Gamesradar, you can invite up to nine other friends by sending them a link. Here you go directly to the browser version of Minecraft.

Play Minecraft for free in the browser

We’ll take you straight to the free browser version of Minecraft.

To the game

Apparently there is no way to save a game in the browser. So if you want to continue playing, you might want to leave your browser tab and continue your “block adventure”.

Free games

Alternatively, we at netzwelt also guide you to download Minecraft and also show you which first-person shooters you can play for free.
